alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 13 at 12:03AM AKST until December 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, Central Inner Channels along the Mitkof Highway. * WHEN...Until 800 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1159 PM AKST, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the advisory area. Falls Creek has just passed minor flood stage and continues to rise. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible. - Other ungauged streams in the area may also be near or above bankfull level leading to potential minor flooding. - For Falls Creek near Petersburg: At 11:00pm the stage was 22.66 feet. Flood Stage is 22.5 feet.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
